contentrichtext.text: {{MedalTableTop|Viktor Ruban cropped.jpg|240px|Ruban at the 2012 Olympics}} {{MedalSport | Men's [[Archery]]}} {{MedalCountry|{{UKR}}}} {{MedalCompetition|Olympic Games}} {{MedalGold| [[2008 Summer Olympics|Beijing 2008]] | [[Archery at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's individual|Individual]] }} {{MedalBronze| [[2004 Summer Olympics|Athens 2004]] | [[Archery at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's team|Team]] }} {{MedalBottom}} '''Viktor Ruban''' (born 24 May 1981 in [[Kharkiv]], [[Ukrainian SSR]], [[Soviet Union]]) is an [[Archery at the Summer Olympics|Olympic gold medal winning]] [[World Archery Rankings#Number one ranked archers|former world number one]] [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] [[Target archery|archer]]. ==2004 Summer Olympics== Ruban competed at the [[2004 Summer Olympics]] in men's individual archery. He won his first match, advancing to the round of 32; he also won his second match, advancing to the round of 16. In the third match, he lost to [[Laurence Godfrey (archer)|Laurence Godfrey]] of Great Britain. Ruban placed 13th overall. Ruban was also a member of the [[bronze medal]] Ukrainian men's archery team at the 2004 Summer Olympics. ==2008 Summer Olympics== At the [[2008 Summer Olympics]] in Beijing Ruban finished his ranking round with a total of 678 points, just one point behind [[Juan René Serrano]] and equal with [[Mangal Singh Champia]]. This gave him the third seed for the final competition bracket in which he faced [[Maged Youssef]] in the first round, beating the [[Egypt]]ian 111-96. In the second round Ruban was too strong for [[Michael Naray]] (115-105) and via [[Jacek Proć]] (114-108) in the third round he advanced to the quarter finals. There he had no problem beating [[Moriya Ryuichi]] 115-106. In the semi final he and his opponent [[Bair Badënov]] both came to 112 points and an extra round was needed. Here Ruban scored 20 points and Badënov 18, which brought Ruban into the final. In the final he claimed the gold by beating [[Park Kyung-Mo]] by 113-112. Together with [[Markiyan Ivashko]] and [[Oleksandr Serdyuk]] he also took part in the team event. With the highest score from the ranking round combined with the 676 of Serdyuk and the 658 of Ivashko Ukraine were in second position after the ranking round, which gave them a straigh seed into the quarter finals. With 214-211 they were too strong for the [[Chinese Taipei]] team, but in the semi final they were eliminated by Italy 223-221.
